website_summaries.verdict: Valve's sequel to its groundbreaking 2007 brain-bender lives up to the wildness and whimsy of its predecessor.
cons: Cooperative mode expansions get expensive quickly

customer_reviews.title: Off to play the original!
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me as a great 'first' PC game (other than the sims and Minecraft I wasn't much of a gamer till recently) and it was perfect. I'm terrible at puzzles - I just can't visualise or think through how they work - so I did spend a lot of time on the Portal 2 wiki, however I never got bored because I HAD to know what happened next. The puzzles are challenging, the story is gripping, and the visuals of the game? Absolutely gorgeous. I recommend playing with an Xbox 360 PC controller for the best experience. Mouse and keyboard seemed to clunky for this.
customer_reviews.author: B.R.G

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant sequel
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoyed the original Portal, you'll like this one equally. More of the same puzzle-solving in a freaky, fairly immersive environment with beautiful graphics (and not too taxing on my older hardware). My only tiny gripe is that due to a glitch of some sort I got stuck on a level (with a cube missing somehow) and after looking at videos on how to solve the level it seems I've missed nothing and my only option is to start over and work my way back to the level so I can take it on in its re-set form. An option to reset a level would make this slick perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Winn-smith

customer_reviews.title: You need this in your life
customer_reviews.text: Portal 2 is quite possibly the best game ever made (to date), and I don't say that lightly! The fantastic blend of addictive puzzle solving, immersive environments and hilarious dialogue takes the solid foundation of the original Portal and blows it out of the water. The new multiplayer element is a very different dynamic which takes a little while to get the hang of, but is brilliant in its own right, you really have to communicate with your "partner in science" to solve the puzzles, and it's really rewarding. Installs into Steam like other Valve games, but having the disk means you don't have to wait ages for it to download. Everyone should give this game a try. 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: God help you if you need technical support
customer_reviews.text: The game itself was very entertaining to play for an entire week until it developed a glitch coursing it to crash. (this is on a brand new PC) These things happen! it wouldn't be such an issue but for the fact the developer and distributor seem to have a cut and run policy with respect to their after care of customers. Their technical support is a joke. From online forums i see, dating back over a year, other people have the exact same problem and yet no update has been released to fix the issue.

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: It's short, the story is uninteresting, the annoying british bot is not funny at all, game fails at the supposed humour overall... Gameplay the same as the first. It's a rip off, stick with Portal 1 which was cheaper. Portal 2 isn't worth 1 cent more. It's actually worse. The puzzles are way too easy by the way. But i guess the well paid voice actors are there to distract you from that fact. Shame
customer_reviews.author: José S.

product_meta.title: Portal 2 (PC/Mac DVD)
product_meta.description:
Platform:PCPortal 2 draws from the award-winning formula of innovative gameplay, story, and music that earned the original Portal over 70 industry accolades and created a cult following.The single-player portion of Portal 2 introduces a cast of dynamic new characters, a host of fresh puzzle elements, and a much larger set of devious test chambers. Players will explore never-before-seen areas of the Aperture Science Labs and be reunited with GLaDOS, the occasionally murderous computer companion who guided them through the original game.The game's two-player cooperative mode features its own entirely separate campaign with a unique story, test chambers, and two new player characters. This new mode forces players to reconsider everything they thought they knew about portals. Success will require them to not just act cooperatively, but to think cooperatively.

MANUFACTURER'S DESCRIPTION
Coming this April to four major platforms (PC, Xbox 360, PS3, and Mac) Portal 2 draws from the award-winning formula of innovative gameplay, story, and music that earned the original Portal over 70 industry accolades and created a cult following. 

The single-player portion of Portal 2 introduces a cast of dynamic new characters, a host of fresh puzzle elements, and a much larger set of devious test chambers. Players will explore never-before-seen areas of the Aperture Science Labs and be reunited with GLaDOS, the occasionally murderous computer companion who guided them through the original game. 

The game’s two-player cooperative mode features its own entirely separate campaign with a unique story, test chambers, and two new player characters. This new mode forces players to reconsider everything they thought they knew about portals. Success will require them to not just act cooperatively, but to think cooperatively.
feature_bullets: Extensive single player game featuring next generation gameplay and a wildly-engrossing story
Complete two-person co-operative multiplayer game featuring its own dedicated story, characters, and gameplay
Advanced use of physics allow for the creation of a whole new range of interesting challenges, producing a much larger but not harder game
A massive sequel to the title named 2007's Game of the Year by over 30 publications worldwide
Available worldwide for the PC, PS3, Mac and Xbox 360
